title: Risk Partner Manager, Local Payment Methods
content:
Who we are
About Stripe
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.
About the team
As Stripe continues to develop innovative products that serve businesses of all sizes worldwide, the complexity and scale of risk will increase. By joining our Risk Partnerships team, you will have a critical role in ensuring the financial and partnership health of the company. You will enable Stripe's growth and collaborate with both internal and external stakeholders to identify and address key risks.
What you’ll do
Stripe is seeking a Risk Partner Manager to help us scale for the future in a fast-paced environment that is growing rapidly. It is expected that the Risk Partner Manager will quickly become knowledgeable in Stripe's risk policies, including fraud, credit, and brand risk, as well as staying up to date on emerging trends within the industry and competitors.
Your responsibilities will include building strategic relationships with Risk counterparts within our EMEA payment method partners to support Stripe's risk and commercial initiatives. It is equally important for you to develop trusting and collaborative relationships with internal stakeholders who will provide subject matter expertise and execute across multiple programs and initiatives. Your work will be highly visible to Risk leadership and be instrumental to driving our future growth. 
Responsibilities
Who you are
We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.
Minimum requirements

10+ years of professional experience, including 3+ years in payments risk management 
An in-depth understanding of EMEA local payment methods 
A strong sense of ownership, resilience, and drive to make an impact
Experience in managing day-to-day risk across a variety of internal and external partners
Strong stakeholder management skills, including navigating difficult situations, negotiating timelines, and influencing internal and external stakeholders across organizations and borders
An analytical approach to decision-making; you understand how to partner with Data Science to build metrics and track progress across various monitoring programs
Demonstrated project/program management skills and a proven track record of building and scaling programs from the ground up
Excellent collaboration, communication, and relationship building skills. You must be able to convey complex ideas succinctly to all audiences
Effective program management skills and a proven track record of building and scaling programs from the ground up. You are highly organized and unafraid to challenge and motivate teams and yourself

Preferred requirements

You have an in-depth understanding of product and payment platforms
You have experience in managing or interacting with financial partners, ideally local payment method partners
You are familiar with using SQL to extract and analyse data

questions.label: Please select the country where you currently reside.
Please select the country or countries you anticipate working in for the role in which you are applying.
Are you authorized to work in the location(s) you selected in your previous response?
Will you require Stripe to sponsor you for a work permit now or in the future for the location(s) you selected in in your previous response?

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
questions.label: If this role offers the option to work from a remote location, do you plan to work remotely?

values.label: Yes, I intend to work remotely.
No, I intend to work from an office location.
